name: Mike Bloomberg
bio: Entrepreneur, philanthropist, UN Secretary-General’s Special Envoy for Climate Ambition & Solutions, mayor of NYC, father, grandfather, and data nerd.

social_posts.post_text: Bono has inspired countless people – including me – to do good in the world. Great to join him for the launch of his new memoir Surrender – a chronicle of his journey in music as well as his life-saving activism.

The Bloomberg Fellows program at @johnshopkinssph provides a full scholarship for individuals working for organizations tackling pressing problems, like obesity & the food system, addiction & overdose, adolescent health, violence and the climate crisis, seeking a MPH or DrPH degree.
The Fellows are future public health leaders - and I’m glad I got to spend time with some of them and learn about their work at the Bloomberg #AmericanHealthSummit in Philadelphia today.

America’s COVID-19, overdose death, and gun homicide rates are the highest in the developed world. 

We’re not moving fast enough to reverse declining life expectancy in the United States. #AmericanHealthSummit

Few people have ever played a bigger role on the New York City stage than Dan Doctoroff, one of the deputy mayors from our administration.

He spearheaded our work to reshape the Far West Side, and re-imagined a train yard as the center of a new neighborhood.

He's since brought @TheShedNY to life with art and culture, energy and possibility. He's an example of what's possible when people dream big, work tirelessly, and find creative ways to bring people together.

I'm glad I got a chance to celebrate him last night as we announced the lobby at The Shed would be named after him.

The data is clear: STEM PhD programs don’t reflect the diversity of other fields or our country. 

To solve for that, @BloombergDotOrg partnered with my alma mater @JohnsHopkinsU to create the Vivien Thomas Scholars Initiative, an effort that creates opportunities for PhD students from underrepresented backgrounds in science, technology, engineering and math fields. 

These students could pioneer advances we have not yet imagined, and shape the lives of generations to come - and it was great to meet the first cohort of Vivien Thomas Scholars at the Bloomberg #AmericanHealthSummit in Philadelphia earlier this week.

This is a great day for equal rights in America, and a powerful testament to how organized and effective advocacy can lead to laws that guarantee fundamental rights — rights that are too important to leave to the Supreme Court's changing politics. More than a half-century after the Stonewall Uprising, and more than a decade after helping to win passage of same-sex marriage in New York State and supporting it nationally, I want to congratulate everyone who played a role in achieving this critically important safeguard of individual rights.

Today, as we remember the 26 people killed in the massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School 10 years ago, most of them young children, let’s also remember the outrage we felt that day, when the horrible realization hit us that not even elementary schools are safe from America’s epidemic of gun violence. And let’s remember what so many of us said to ourselves, and to our families: ‘We can't let this continue.’ In the aftermath of the massacre, I met with family members of those killed, and I took to heart what they told me: the best way to honor their loved ones is to turn anguish into action and help spare other families from suffering the same unimaginable grief. Over the past decade, nearly 10 million Americans have joined @Everytown and @MomsDemand and have successfully advocated for lifesaving policies at every level of government, including the first major gun law to pass Congress in a generation. And yet the progress we’ve made is still far short of what’s needed. Ten years after the death of 26 young children and educators, it is still far too easy for people who pose a danger to themselves or others to buy guns, as it is for those with criminal records – and every day, we see the tragic results. We will continue pushing to close the loopholes in our gun laws, and we won’t stop until all Americans are safe in schools and other public places. We owe that to the Sandy Hook survivors, and to the millions of other Americans whose homes and communities have been shattered by senseless gun violence. I hope you'll join us. everytown.org/join regram @momsdemand

This year, @bloombergdotorg stepped up to take on big challenges. 

We invested in K-12 education, doubled down on protecting the planet, expanded our commitment to improving public health, teamed up with the world’s mayors, transformed cities through art, used data to advance racial wealth equity, and created economic opportunities for women. 

That’s just the tip of the iceberg, and we believe the best is yet to come. 

Wishing you all a happy holiday!
Merry Christmas! 🎄 Wishing you all a happy and healthy holiday season.

In 2022, gun violence was the leading cause of death for children & teens in America. In 2023, we must do everything we can to change that. @Everytown is fighting to end gun violence. If you donate online to their work today at the link in my bio, I'll triple match your gift.

In the aftermath of the 9/11 attacks, we vowed to never forget. Today, it’s critical that we show a new generation how to face adversity with the same kind of resilience & hope we saw 21 years ago. Please consider donating to @911memorial by 12/31 at the link in my bio, and I will match your gift.
New York was lucky to share in Pelé's legendary life, and it was an honor to meet with him as he was helping to revive the Cosmos.

Barbara Walters was much more than a pioneer of broadcast journalism who helped break open the field for generations of talented women. She was also a legendary New Yorker, a generous supporter of charitable causes, and, I'm lucky to say, a great friend. I always enjoyed joining her on The View. We had a lot of laughs together over the years, and I'm going to miss her.

It was an honor to welcome Pope Benedict XVI to NYC in 2008. His visits to the World Trade Center and a synagogue - the first time a pope had ever visited an American synagogue - reflected his commitment to healing and peace. Today, as people of all faiths remember his spirit, we also honor his leadership in confronting climate change and rallying public support for environmental protection.

We launched Bloomberg Radio 30 years ago today, ignoring the sensationalism that defined radio at the time to focus on great news and financial journalism. Thank you to the journalists, producers, guests & others who've helped us build a worldwide audience, and keep growing.

As part of our effort to help close the racial wealth divide, we announced in 2020 that the @BloombergDotOrg Greenwood Initiative would help reduce the medical school debts of students at historically Black medical schools. Today, I met with a few of those HBMS graduates who shared their excitement at beginning careers in family and emergency medicine, as well as surgery, ophthalmology and psychiatry.

For decades @therickstengel has chronicled major moments and figures in history. I was glad to join him tonight to celebrate his latest work, the podcast Mandela: The Lost Tapes, and to gain a deeper understanding of one of the modern era's greatest leaders.

For 10 years, @MomsDemand has been at the forefront of the fight to end gun violence. They’ve changed policy working with bipartisan partners on school boards, in states, and at the federal level. They’ve elected gun sense candidates up and down the ballot. And through the strength of their army of volunteers and the grassroots energy they bring, they’ve stood strong against the NRA and politicians in the pocket of the gun lobby. They do life-saving work, and #10YearsOfMoms have made us all safer.
null

Prime Minister @JacindaArdern's decision to step down is a loss for the global community as well as the people of New Zealand, but I have no doubt she'll find new ways to remain at the forefront of issues she's most passionate about, including climate change and gun safety. Her strong and decisive approach to the pandemic and the mass shooting at Christchurch — leading with pragmatism, facts, and resolve — reflected her approach to climate action, too, and I look forward to seeing where her commitment to service will lead her next.

The faster we can make solar and wind the primary source of power and fossil fuels the last resort, the more reliable our energy system will be, the lower our electric bills will be, and the healthier and safer our families and communities will be.

I wrote about the recent blackouts for @bloombergopinion — read my piece at the link in bio.

On the 50th anniversary of Roe, millions of women are being denied their fundamental rights, but a powerful movement to restore those rights is underway. Voters have rallied to achieve crucial victories in a diverse group of states, and I've been glad to support them. We are on the march, and we aren't stopping until all women across the country can access safe and legal abortion care.

This week marks the 20th anniversary since we gave the green light for @christojeanneclaude’s historic public art project “The Gates” after decades of their efforts to bring it to life.
It was a great example of how public art can provoke debate, spark our imaginations, and help us redefine the space we live in.
null

February 1 marks the approximate time that gun deaths in the U.S. surpass the number of gun deaths experienced by peer countries in an entire calendar year. That's unacceptable. 

This National Gun Violence Survivors Week, we recognize there are far too many people who are living each day with the lasting trauma of surviving gun violence. Their stories are reminders of why we must continue to work for commonsense changes that will keep us all safe. momentsthatsurvive.org #GVSurvivorsWeek

Twenty years ago, I signed the Smoke-Free Air Act in New York City, banning smoking in indoor workplaces, including bars and restaurants. Despite initial resistance, the change was incredibly popular — as it turns out, people like having a meal or working a shift without coming home smelling like smoke. Food and beverage industry workers – and tens of thousands of New Yorkers — are healthier today because of that law, and the idea has spread to cities and countries around the world.
 
Even after decades of progress, smoking continues to take a massive toll on our health, and Big Tobacco continues to peddle its addictive products — including to kids. So today, @BloombergDotOrg announced a new commitment of $420 million to the Bloomberg Initiative to Reduce Tobacco Use, with the aim of cutting tobacco use in low- and middle-income countries, and reducing e-cigarette use among US teenagers. Tap the link in bio to learn more.
I’d been trying to write a new pizza joke, but I couldn’t work out the delivery. #NationalPizzaDay

More than 41,000 were killed - and many still are missing - following powerful earthquakes in Turkey and Syria. 

Learn more about how Bloomberg and Bloomberg Philanthropies are supporting efforts on the ground.

Growing up, food and conversations at the dinner table brought my family together.

On the latest episode of @ruthiestable4 podcast, I spoke with @ruthierogers on the role food played in my childhood, @bloomberg’s open offices, and my go-to comfort food.
 
Link in bio to listen to the full episode.

Thirty years ago today, at 12:18 p.m. ET, a bomb exploded in the basement of the World Trade Center, claiming six lives. Today the @911Memorial will hold a moment of silence at 12:18 p.m. ET to remember and honor those we lost, as well as the survivors and the first responders who acted with such courage that day. Link in bio to learn more.
✍️ @mikebloomberg

When the Perelman Performing Arts Center opens in September 2023, its innovative design elements will make it a place unlike any other.

It will serve as a reminder of the ongoing renewal of the @wtc site, and a place for people to come together through inspiration, exploration, and creativity.

I can't wait to see this ambitious vision come fully to life.

In New York, #COP28 President-Designate #DrSultanAlJaber and @MikeBloomberg, UN Special Envoy for Climate Ambition & Solutions, announced a new partnership to bolster meaningful climate action from cities, business, financial institutions & more - supported by @BloombergDotOrg and @Bloomberg. 

“Cities and local communities, states and regions, and businesses and investors have increasingly led the way in cutting emissions. Thanks to their leadership, these groups will have a formal role in this year's COP for the first time, which can mark an historic turning point in the global fight against climate change.” - @MikeBloomberg.

"Our partnership with @MikeBloomberg will mobilize all parts of global society to make #COP28 the turning point for 🌍 climate progress.” - #DrSultanAlJaber on the partnership that aims to drive transformation within the energy sector & guide us towards #NetZero pathways.

text_entities.entity: special envoy for climate ambition & solutions

social_posts.post_text: On Saturday mornings in the winter growing up, I went to the @museumofscience for lectures that introduced the natural and physical world in a way my school could not. Each week, for two hours, I sat spellbound as an instructor brought snakes, porcupines, and owls for us to hold; demonstrated the basic laws of physics with hands-on experiments; and quizzed us on every museum exhibit. All the kids—including me—tried to show off by having every answer. This competition taught the value of precise observation, attention to detail, and careful listening. Once the question concerned the age of a tree whose five-foot cross section was displayed in the museum upstairs. The exhibit had great historical events marked by a light bulb at each appropriate tree ring, from the current-day outside circle back to the tree’s germination, centuries earlier, at the center of the display. The question was asked about “the redwood tree.” We were suitably frustrated by an instructor who refused to accept what we all knew was the “right” answer, until someone realized the tree cross section was not from a redwood at all, but rather from a giant sequoia—a related but slightly different variety. Listen, question, test, think: Those instructors taught me the value of intellectual honesty and scholarship years before college.

The five winners of the inaugural Partnership for Healthy Cities Awards – Athens, Bengaluru, Mexico City, Montevideo, and Vancouver – are finding groundbreaking ways to save and improve lives. Tomorrow — and for years to come — their solutions will help inspire other cities around the world to learn, innovate, and take action on some of the biggest challenges we face. #Cities4Health

Poor air quality creates public health concerns that impact the daily lives of millions of people worldwide. But as we’ve seen in London, cities around the world are tackling this critical issue with the urgency it needs.

The inaugural Partnership for Health Cities Summit was a resounding success. The communication and collaboration that happened here will help cities tackle air pollution and improve lives around the world. #Cities4Health
Wishing everyone who celebrates a happy St. Patrick’s Day ☘️

NYC is my home, but I love London.

From visiting our colleagues at the @bloomberg European HQ to meeting with mayors and city leaders from 50+ countries at the inaugural Partnership for Healthy Cities Summit, this trip to London Town was a memorable one.

Until next time 👋

As @UnitedNations Secretary-General @AntonioGuterres says, "the climate time-bomb is ticking" and we have to move faster than ever before. As his Special Envoy on Climate Ambition & Solutions, I know that mayors, young people, business leaders, innovators, nonprofits, and investors around the world are ready to make an impact with their ambitious ideas. Today, I joined the Secretary-General at the United Nations in New York to talk about how we can mobilize to accelerate climate action and protect our planet. 📸: UN Photo/Mark Garten

text_entities.entity: special envoy on climate ambition & solutions

social_posts.post_text: It’s @mlb Opening Day!  #TBT to when I threw the first pitch on opening day at a @siyankees game ⚾️

My father was the son of immigrants. He came to the library, because he treasured books, and the opportunity to learn more, and to better himself. My mother was the daughter of an immigrant. She went to the Medford Public Library until the very end of her life, because she loved books, and she loved being in the book club with her neighbors. 

Our family thought that the Medford Public Library was so much more than a building with books. It was an invitation to dream, and to expand our horizons. That’s what libraries do. And I’ve always believed that keeping those invitations open and free is incredibly important – to our communities, and to our country.

Last year, I was glad to join my sister Marjorie at the dedication of the new Charlotte and William Bloomberg Medford Public Library named in honor of my parents. 

Happy #NationalLibraryDay — I hope you visit your local library soon.

Here's to one of my favorite shows...and one of my favorite roles. 

The @phantomopera will always be...here inside my mind.

City governments face a growing number of challenges, from protecting public health and safety, to creating jobs, to confronting the accelerating climate crisis. Local leaders are responding with creativity, innovation, and a deep commitment to building stronger, more resilient communities.

As they do, the Bloomberg @CenterforCities at @Harvard, unveiled today, will provide public sector leaders with opportunities to develop executive leadership skills and learn new strategies for tackling the biggest challenges we face.

In a little over a decade, @BloombergDotOrg has worked with our partners to:
✅ close 70% of U.S. coal-fired power plants
✅ stop ⅓ of planned methane plants in the U.S. 
✅ pass clean energy laws in 20 U.S. states & territories
✅ create and expand marine protected areas
 
As people around the world celebrate Earth Day, we know that major progress to fight climate change is possible. There’s much more to do, so we’re working with everyone from city officials to grassroots organizers to business leaders to accelerate climate action and protect our planet’s future.

At @Bloomberg, our urban beekeeping program is a unique way for us, as a company, to support environmental sustainability and engage with our employees. You could even say our Bloombees are buzz-worthy.

Learn more about the social and environmental impact of this program and our other sustainability initiatives - link in bio.

Work hard, play hard.  

Thanks to all who joined us to celebrate #TakeYourKidstoWorkDay!

At @Bloomberg, we lead by example.  Nearly 55% of our global electricity consumption is sourced from renewable energy like our 15-acre solar system in New Jersey. And I’m glad to share we’re on track to reach 100% clean energy by 2025.  Learn more about how we’re working to hit our absolute emissions reduction targets - link in bio.
It was an honor to speak with the Joint Chiefs and the combatant commanders hosted by General Mark Milley. We talked about what it takes to foster a culture of innovation across large organizations.

@officialnormanfoster’s designs have shaped the skylines of cities around the world - including @bloomberg’s European HQ in London. Incredible to tour the architect’s retrospective at @centrepompidou together.

When I was 39, I was fired from the only full-time job I'd ever had - a job I loved. The day after I was laid off, I started my own company, based on an idea nearly everyone thought would fail: making financial information available to people, right on their desktops. Remember, this was before people had desktops! 

Setbacks are only setbacks if you allow them to be - and in order to succeed, you must first be willing to fail.
Over the years, I’ve had the privilege of speaking to graduates at colleges across the country, and there are a few pieces of advice that I believe always hold true.

We see time and time again that art can remake streets and improve public safety, inspire people, draw in visitors, and enhance residents’ quality of life.

As mayor, our team worked to increase pedestrian safety and reduce traffic injuries in NYC with a ground-up redesign of @timessquarenyc. Through the @BloombergDotOrg Asphalt Art Initiative, we’re helping cities use art and community engagement to improve street safety and revitalize public spaces. 

Our new round of grants will help more communities around the world (now including Canada and Mexico) make their public spaces safer and more inviting.

It’s amazing what innovative designs, a few cans of paint, and a forward-looking community, can achieve. Learn more about how cities in Canada, Mexico, and the U.S. can apply for a grant - link in bio.

When I served as mayor of New York City, we used data to help clean the air, improve schools, strengthen public health, and so much more. Today, with cities around the world growing quickly and local leaders expected to do more and more, good data is absolutely critical.

The @BloombergDotOrg City Data Alliance is dedicated to helping mayors and their teams harness the power of data, so they can improve the lives of their residents and tackle some of the biggest challenges we face.

One of the things I love most about my travels is meeting with colleagues at @bloomberg offices around the world.

I recently visited team members in Paris and Frankfurt, where I also spoke with @frans__timmermans and business leaders about the urgency of big challenges like climate change. In Paris, I toured the new Norman Foster exhibition (@officialnormanfoster) at @centrepompidou which highlights many of his iconic creations throughout the world, including our @bloomberg headquarters in London.

Congratulations to the newest graduates of the Goldman Sachs 10,000 Small Businesses program in Baltimore.

Small businesses are the backbone of almost every local economy. You’re part of a network of nearly 550 alumni businesses in the area that foster economic mobility, open doors of opportunity for young people, inspire the next generation of entrepreneurs.

For today, take it all in, and enjoy the celebrations. 
Tomorrow, you’ll get right back to work -- growing your companies, your communities, and your city.
 
Thank you to @davidsolomon, @goldmansachs, the entire 10,000 Small Businesses team, @govwesmoore, @mayorbmscott, and our education partners @johnshopkinsu @morganstateu @ccbcmd for all your enthusiasm and commitment in this program.

I know museums can have a significant impact on young people — because I was one of those young people. 

As a child growing up in Medford, my visits to the @museumofscience inspired my interest in science and technology and forever shaped the way I think.

Everyone deserves access to those cultural and learning opportunities and to hear insights and stories, and that’s the driving idea behind @BloombergDotOrg’s Bloomberg Connects mobile app. The app has helped so many people experience culture in new ways.

So, this #InternationalMuseumDay, download the free @bloombergconnects app and access behind the scenes stories and insights from museums and cultural spaces, from New York to London, Bengaluru to Tel Aviv.

Photo slideshow:

[1] “Another View from Nowhen” by Isabel Nolan at Bloomberg SPACE

[2] Tours Cezanne Exhibit at the @Tate Modern

[3] Mike with curator Abraham Thomas at “The Roof Garden Commission: Lauren Halsey” at @metmuseum 

[4] Mike with architect Norman Foster at "Norman Foster" at @centrepompidou 

[5] Mike visiting "Luchita Hurtado: I Live I Die I Will Be Reborn" at @serpentineuk in 2019. Artwork © The Estate of Luchita Hurtado

[6] Mike with @themuseumofmodernart director Glenn Lowry on a walkthrough of "Georgia O'Keeffe"

Accelerating the deployment of renewable energy in emerging markets requires partnerships across government, business, and nonprofit sectors. As we prepare for @cop28uaeofficial, @bloombergdotorg and @irenaimages will work together with countries in the Global South to help drive widespread adoption of renewable energy, and reduce political, technical, and financial barriers to the energy transition.

On my visit to Abu Dhabi this week, I had the privilege of visiting the Abrahamic Family House, an interfaith complex housing a mosque, church, the UAE’s first ever purpose-built synagogue, and an educational center designed by @adjaye_visual_sketchbook. I’ve always said that of all our precious freedoms, the most important may be the freedom to worship as we wish. This landmark not only serves as a place for worship, but also for learning, dialogue, and inspiring understanding and peace. Thank you to Abdulla Al Shehhi, Director of the @abrahamicfh, and @rabbi.sarna, Chief Rabbi, @afhsynagogue, for the thoughtful tour.

Congratulations to the Class of 2023! As you decide what’s next for your lives and careers, my advice is to remember this: Nothing is more rewarding than knowing that you’ve given back to your communities and served others with the work you do.

Since @citibike’s launch 10 years ago today, it’s provided 180 million rides and grown from 6,000 bikes to almost 30,000. Happy birthday Citi Bike - here’s to millions more safe, climate-friendly, affordable trips around NYC.

21 years ago today, the Last Column was removed from Ground Zero, marking an end to recovery efforts. Just as we will never forget those who died on the day of the attacks, we will never forget the sacrifices of those who did so much to help our city in the aftermath. 

I encourage you to visit the Memorial Glade at the @911memorial, which was built to honor their sacrifices, or go to 911memorial.org and leave a tribute in remembrance of all they did, and what they gave.

When government, philanthropy, and private industry work together, we can expand economic opportunities for women to strengthen their communities. 

As the U.S. and international leaders look to women’s economic participation to reduce poverty and improve economies, our Women’s Economic Development Initiative offers a scalable, impactful model for organizations, foundations, and governments that wish to invest in women’s economic independence. 

Learn more about an independent study from @SAISHopkins, which details how our Women’s Economic Development Initiative is helping women develop marketable skills in high-demand industries – and how it can be replicated around the world – at the link in bio.

American children & teens die from gun violence more than any other cause of death, and lax gun laws threaten the safety of every school, workplace, restaurant, and public space. A vast majority of Americans want to see stronger, sensible gun laws. Today is National Gun Violence Awareness Day & the start of #WearOrange Weekend, when we wear orange to honor the survivors of gun violence, and show elected officials how many millions of us across the country expect action to protect our kids and the places where we come together. Join me and learn more at WearOrange.org.

I never miss a chance to meet with my @bloomberg colleagues when I’m traveling, and I had a great visit with employees on my recent trip to Abu Dhabi.

I also took a tour of the Abrahamic Family House with its director, Abdulla Al Shehhi, and spoke with the Chief Rabbi @rabbi.sarna of the @afhsynagogue. I was deeply moved by the powerful spaces of the @abrahamicfh, and the opportunities they create for reflection, fellowship, and interfaith engagement.

London Mayor @Sadiq Khan's new book Breathe is proof that climate progress is possible, told by a leader who has been on the frontlines of the fight. At a moment when we need to accelerate action, the stories he shares about navigating — and overcoming — political gridlock, apathy, cynicism, and more are important and inspiring.

“When New York City faces adversity, New Yorkers don’t let down, they build up.” - @mikebloomberg, Perelman Performing Arts Center (PAC NYC) Chair of the Board of Directors, and 108th Mayor of New York City

We have been building up, up, and up as a part of the restoration of the @WTC Campus to make @pac_nyc a reality. We cannot wait to welcome everyone this September.

[Video Description: A voiceover from former Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg with images of New York City and a new performing arts center with a striated marble exterior]

Completing the rebuilding of the @wtc site with @pac_nyc, which will bring people from around the world together to experience joy, understanding, and connection through the arts, is incredibly meaningful.

This venue is unlike any other in the city or the world, and I'm deeply grateful to the many people who took part in fulfilling this ambitious vision.
null

Sydney ➡ New York ➡ London ➡ Hong Kong ➡ Princeton ➡ São Paulo

Across the globe, Bloomberg celebrates LGBTQ+ inclusion this Pride month and every month.

In college, my classmates crowded around a 14-inch black and white television to watch The Beatles' first appearance on The Ed Sullivan Show. I had no idea who they were at the time, but I knew they were different than anything I’d ever seen. That memory made it extra special to join @PaulMcCartney last night to see photos he took at the height of Beatlemania - including on The Ed Sullivan Show - at the @NationalPortraitGallery. No matter where you are in the world, you can experience the exhibition, too - just download the @bloombergconnects app.

The @SerpentineUK invites a thought-provoking architect to design its Summer Pavilion each year - and @linaghotmeh_architecture's À table is no exception. Made with bio-sourced and low-carbon materials, Ghtomeh's design encourages visitors to sit, exchange ideas, and eat together. If you can, be sure to visit before it closes on October 29th. 

First Photo: Iwan Baan, Courtesy: Serpentine
Glad to meet Prime Minister @rishisunakmp, who continues to show strong commitment to accelerating action on climate change, advancing scientific innovation, and boosting investment in the UK.

The Supreme Court’s decision on affirmative action will make it harder for colleges and universities to be what our country urgently needs them to be: engines of opportunity that propel us toward a more equal society.

Read my op-ed at the link in my bio.

No matter what he said about leaving his heart somewhere out west, Anthony Benedetto from Astoria always saved his greatest love for his hometown. Besides being one of the world’s greatest singers, Tony Bennett was humble and gracious, loyal and generous. He and his wife Susan founded a terrific public school for young artists in Queens, and I was honored to be introduced by him on its stage at the 2010 State of the City address. We’re going to miss Tony dearly, but as his foundation continues to help students explore the arts and pursue their dreams, his inspiring legacy will live on.

Bloomberg and @bloombergdotorg are both dedicated to the same goal: give back and give big. Our employees are making a difference every day by volunteering their time and talents in the cities where they live and work. Find out more in our latest Annual Report. Link in bio.

It was truly something else to visit the Sonic Sphere at @theshedny, and see how far artists and innovators can push the boundaries of creativity in this incredible space. I want to thank the team that made this all possible, and commend them for bringing yet another groundbreaking cultural experience to NYC.

It was great to meet with our newest class of @Bloomberg interns - an impressive group. We're glad they're starting their careers with us, and we hope many will be back. We have a long tradition of hiring interns as full-time employees, which has served us incredibly well — and I look forward to seeing it continue. #NationalInternDay

For 15 years, @bloombergdotorg and @who have worked collaboratively to cut smoking rates globally. We’ve seen tremendous progress:

- Smoke-free policies in 74 countries total
- Additional tobacco controls that protect more than 5 billion people
- Global smoking prevalence declined from 22.8% in 2007 to 17.0% in 2021

Yet, there’s much more to be done. We know that tobacco companies will keep trying to spread their addictive products, especially to young people, putting new generations at risk of cancer, heart disease, and premature death. 

We’re going to keep building on our success, keep pushing back, and keep winning this fight to save lives.

A new @who report highlights that over  70% of the world’s population is now protected with at least one best practice policy against deadly tobacco – five times more than in 2007.

I congratulate #Mauritius on becoming the first country in Africa, and the #Netherlands on becoming the first in the 🇪🇺 to implement the full package of WHO tobacco control policies.

WHO stands ready to support all countries to follow these examples and protect their people from this deadly scourge. #NoTobacco!

On August 1, 1981 - 42 years ago today - I got laid off from the only full-time job I'd ever had, with two months notice. It was embarrassing – none of my friends got fired. It was hurtful - after all the years I had devoted to the firm. It was worrisome – what would I do now? And it was unfair, or at least I thought so. But it also became a turning point in my life. I was 39 at the time and had no idea what the future held. I worked as hard as ever for those next two months, if not harder –– to prove the bosses wrong –– and the morning after my last day, I got to work on an idea that nearly everyone thought was crazy, an idea that became @Bloomberg.
 
Show me a person who has never failed and I will show you a failure of a person. What we learn from failure, and what we do with that knowledge, is what matters –– and it's what makes us who we are.

Photo credit: Ruby Washington/The New York Times/Redux

"Some of the post-pandemic changes in where and how work is done might persist — and some of this innovation, proving itself in competition, might be valuable. Agencies should have flexibility to allow some remote work, particularly where recruitment and retention challenges — which are declining nationally — persist. Yet overall, there’s no good reason why government workers have been so much slower than everyone else to get back to the office at least a few days a week, especially when so many jobs — from social services to law enforcement — require people to be present," writes Mike Bloomberg (@mikebloomberg), co-founder of Bloomberg, founder of Bloomberg Philanthropies, and former mayor of New York City (2002-2013).

"The federal government should lead by example, and the president should keep his promise."

🔗Visit the link in the bio of @PostOpinions to read more.

Cities play a critical role in tackling air pollution. We’re championing local-level actions with partners like @c40cities and the Clean Air Fund to help create innovative solutions in cities around the world.
Mentorship and education pave the way for success. Learn more about how we’re helping to expand opportunities for students of every age in our Annual Report.

Hawaiians are facing heartbreaking and devastating losses of life and land caused by the extreme wildfires last week.

Learn more about how @Bloomberg and @BloombergDotOrg’s partner organizations are supporting efforts on the ground.

The single biggest key to any mayor's success is building a great team — one they can trust to be creative, take risks, and challenge them when needed.

I was glad to meet with the 80 senior city leaders who, like their mayors, are taking part in our Bloomberg Harvard City Leadership Initiative, and talk about their indispensable roles in improving lives in their cities.

The number of semi-automatic firearms exported from the US has more than doubled since 2016, generating big profits for the gun industry — while causing mayhem at the US-Mexico border. Republicans who have assailed the Biden administration for failing to secure the southern border should be the most vocal in demanding action. Those that fail to do so only underscore what has long been true: Too many politicians fear the gun lobby and do its bidding, public safety — and now border security — be damned.  Read my op-ed at the link in my bio.

When I arrived at Johns Hopkins University, I intended to major in physics – until I found out there was a German requirement. After a few days of mangling the language, I switched to the engineering school, and it stuck.

To everyone headed back to school: Good luck! Keep an open mind, stay curious, and follow your passions. You never know where the things you learn may lead you.
Welcoming my friend and @BloombergDotOrg CEO @PattiHarrisPhilanthropy to Instagram! Follow her to get a behind-the-scenes look on what we're working on at Bloomberg Philanthropies.

The @911Memorial is a vital reminder of resilience, resolve, and a shared belief in a brighter future. It's a place where people from every country can come together to honor the lives and legacies of those killed, while also paying tribute to the heroes who lifted us up and inspired us on some of our darkest days. Your support will ensure that the 9/11 Memorial & Museum continues to serve as a symbol of healing and renewal for our visitors from around the world, for many years to come.

Follow the link in my bio to make a donation before midnight on 9/11 - and I will triple your impact.

President Kennedy’s ‘Moonshot’ united millions around a national aspiration.

Now, @princeandprincessofwales’s @earthshotprize is bringing people together around a global necessity: protecting our planet in the face of urgent environmental threats.

The Earthshot Prize celebrates groundbreaking innovators and entrepreneurs using their time, energy and talent to solve environmental challenges. At the #EarthshotInnovationSummit, we celebrated the 2023 finalists – and connected them to a network of business leaders, policymakers, philanthropists and climate activists who can help accelerate and scale their ideas.

The innovative climate solutions of the @earthshotprize winners & finalists— and the good they will do for people & the planet — would not be possible without @princeandprincessofwales’ optimism and leadership.

I'm glad to be partnering together to host the #EarthshotInnovationSummit.

Protecting the environment is an investment in our future.

I'm grateful to @ursulavonderleyen, @treasurydept Secretary Janet Yellen, Mary Schapiro, and Mark Carney for joining us at the Bloomberg Transition Finance Action Forum to discuss how the private financial sector can accelerate and support efforts to create a more sustainable future.

As the climate crisis continues to escalate and has a devastating impact in communities around the world, their expertise is more valuable than ever.

@treasurydept Secretary Janet Yellen has long been one of the world’s most important voices for ensuring that climate risk is recognized as financial risk.

She’s a pioneering leader on climate finance – and we’re grateful to have her with us today at the Bloomberg Transition Finance Action Forum.

Mayor @annehidalgo has been a strong partner in the climate fight and a leader in showing how cities can cut pollution and improve the lives of residents. I met with her earlier this week to talk about how, in the face of escalating climate impacts, local leaders must move even faster and play an even greater role in protecting the planet.

@ursulavonderleyen is a powerful climate advocate - because she sees both the urgent need for action and the unprecedented opportunities that will come with the transition to a net-zero economy.

I’m glad she joined us at the Bloomberg Transition Finance Action Forum to encourage us all to increase our ambition.

The Beyond Carbon campaign has helped retire more than 70% of U.S. coal plants & halted 30% of planned gas development — driving incredible progress in the work to end fossil fuels and accelerate the clean energy transition. 
 
I’m investing another $500 million into the campaign to turbocharge efforts in U.S. cities, states, businesses, and more to move away from carbon pollution. 

Tap the link in my bio to learn more.

Communities near petrochemical facilities are inundated with air and water pollution that causes higher rates of asthma, birth defects and cancers of all kinds. In the past year, the Beyond Petrochemicals campaign fought to raise awareness of these public health nightmares and elevate the grassroots groups working to stop the expansion of this industry. With help from our partners, we have managed to halt the construction of five proposed petrochemical plants, and created long-term strategies that will continue to support the people on the frontlines of pollution. Read more about the campaign at the link in my bio.

Meeting with @environmental_defense_fund President @fred.krupp today was a reminder of his unwavering advocacy for climate solutions that will halt warming this decade, including stopping methane leaks and ramping up private sector investments in clean energy to levels that meet the urgency of the crisis we're facing. 
 
Voices like his will be critical as we head into what may be the most important COP meeting yet. Read the link in my bio about why it’s so important to continue to push for more and greater progress at COP this year.

This moment calls for the highest possible ambitions in our fight against climate change — and at the heart of those ambitions must be assurances that climate progress won't come at a cost to those who can least afford to pay.

First, it's critical that the transition away from fossil fuels is just and equitable, particularly in Southeast Asia and Africa where there are robust opportunities to continue strong growth trajectories with clean, cheap energy. It's also important to ensure that the developing nations holding abundant reserves of the minerals needed for clean technologies are not exploited. Their economies should reap the benefits as more of the world adopts clean energy and demand for their resources grows.

This #UNGA, the @UnitedNations needs to create an international framework to better lay the groundwork for the clean energy transition. I joined UN Secretary-General @AntonioGuterres' Climate Ambition Summit to help forge partnerships to do just that.

Anything less just falls short.

In 2015, Mayor @AnneHidalgo and I convened hundreds of mayors to discuss how we could reduce emissions in cities on the sidelines of COP21 where the historic Paris Agreement was delivered. Cities showed their commitment to setting ambitious targets, implementing practical solutions, pushing their national governments to make bold commitments, and taking tangible steps to reduce their carbon footprint.

Cities are on the frontlines of climate change, and local leaders have an important role to play in taking action. This year at COP28, local leaders will have a significant role as @BloombergDotOrg and @cop28uaeofficial will host the first COP-hosted Local Climate Action Summit. With increased collaboration across all levels of government, we can make progress faster. #ThrowbackThursday

Paraguay's President @SantiPenapy has a bold vision for the future of his country. I was glad to talk to him today about how @BloombergDotOrg is collaborating on public health initiatives there to reduce tobacco use, address cardiovascular disease, and improve health data.

At the #EarthshotInnovationSummit and the Bloomberg Transition Finance Action Forum, heads of state, business leaders, philanthropists and climate innovators from around the globe gathered to accelerate climate progress.
 
Thank you to everyone who joined me to address the biggest threats to our planet ahead of @COP28UAEOfficial. The more we collaborate with others to tackle climate change, the more progress we can make.

Kudos to @POTUS for granting work authorizations to Venezuelan asylum seekers, which will benefit cities and the US economy. More steps are needed to more fully address the crisis, but this was a very important first step in the right direction. Read my latest op-ed in @bloombergopinion.

We pour our values into everything we do, right down to a cup of coffee. The coffee in our pantries comes directly from our long-standing partnership with Sustainable Growers — a program helping advance women farmers across Africa. Learn more in our latest Annual Report.

We need innovative thinking to tackle climate change - and the @EarthshotPrize winners and finalists represent some of the best solutions to the biggest environmental challenges we face. Thanks to all who joined us at the #EarthshotInnovationSummit to scale and spread their groundbreaking ideas.

During my years in City Hall I visited Sderot after it had come under attack from Hamas to express my solidarity with its citizens.

Today, we stand in solidarity with Sderot and with all Israelis again as they defend themselves from terror and violence.

In the wake of this weekend’s appalling terrorist attacks on Israel, I'm stepping up my longtime support for @Magen_David_Adom, the Israeli Red Cross. Magen David Adom operates Israel's ambulances and Medivac units, runs its emergency dispatch system, and trains its paramedics. And as the sole blood supplier for the Israeli Defense Forces, MDA is a lifeline for those who risk their lives for the freedom and security of the Israeli state. 

Right now, MDA has a long list of needs, from life-saving equipment and mobile intensive care units, to blood testing kits and basic supplies for first responders. I've supported MDA since the 1990s, and in 2011, helped dedicate a state-of-the-art EMS station in Jerusalem in honor of my father, William, which was a special moment for our family. I hope you'll consider joining me in supporting Magen David Adom - and if you do, I will match your contribution at afmda.org/bloomberg-match or at the link in my bio.

Tonight, the lights at @Bloomberg HQ in NYC shine in blue and white in support of the people of Israel, in honor of those who risk their lives for Israel's freedom and security, and for those lost in this week's attacks.

Cities are at the center of the greatest challenges facing our world - and the #CityLab2023 summit will bring together mayors, experts, artist, and activists to discuss and discover replicable solutions to urban issues. 

There’s no place more fitting to kick off CityLab than the new @johnshopkinsu Bloomberg Center at 555 Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C., which is designed to facilitate collaboration, discovery, and dialogue on research and policy.

🎥: The Johns Hopkins University Bloomberg Center at 555 Pennsylvania Ave

Cities looking for solutions to the toughest challenges we face are too often forced to reinvent the wheel, with little or no help from outside experts or perspective from other local leaders.

We’re creating a single, dedicated program - the Bloomberg Cities Idea Exchange - that helps local leaders share ideas and innovations that have proven successful, so they can adapt and implement them for their residents. Ready my @citylab op-ed at the link in my bio.

🎉Today at #CityLab2023, we announced the 8 U.S. cities selected to receive $1 million grants to develop public art projects through our #PublicArtChallenge:

🎨 Atlanta, GA (@cityofatlantaga)
🎨 Baltimore, MD (@baltcityhall)
🎨 Honolulu, HI (@honolulu_gov)
🎨 Houston, TX (@houston)
🎨 Orlando, FL (@thecitybeautiful)
🎨 Philadelphia, PA (@CityofPhiladelphia)
🎨 Phoenix, AZ (@cityofphoenixaz)
🎨 Salt Lake City, UT (@slcgov)

These temporary public art projects will bring communities together to tackle local challenges including climate change, equity, food insecurity, gun violence, homelessness, public health, and revitalization.

Learn more - link in bio.

Situated between the White House and the Capitol, the new @johnshopkinsu Bloomberg Center is designed to bring people with different perspectives, backgrounds, and areas of expertise together. It’s a place where students in fields ranging from engineering and public health to government and business can learn with — and from — each other. 
 
From the floor plans to the art on its walls, every detail was chosen to foster the creative thinking, open free exchange of ideas, and interdisciplinary collaboration that our future leaders will need as they step up to take on big challenges.

It’s never been more important for future leaders and innovators to explore, experiment, collaborate, and engage in dialogue.

The new @johnshopkinsu Bloomberg Center at 555 Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C., is designed to create those opportunities for students across the arts, sciences, business, and more.

By creating a space for the next generation of great minds to come together, and giving them access to the experts and resources at Johns Hopkins, we can advance solutions to the challenges that confront Washington, city halls, and beyond.

The TFCD made tremendous strides to bring greater transparency to financial markets around climate-related risks and opportunities. There’s so much work to be done - but they created significant momentum to more fully integrate climate data into the global economy and spur private investment in clean energy.

Visit tcfdhub.org to learn more about the impact of the TCFD recommendations and how they’re being implemented.

The new Johns Hopkins University Bloomberg Center is designed to foster collaboration between policymakers, faculty, and students and brings Johns Hopkins’ world-class research and expertise to the center of Washington.

It will serve as a connecting bridge between both ends of Pennsylvania Avenue, and we can’t wait to see the ideas and initiatives that emerge from the leaders who will come together in this space.

Thank you to everyone who helped make this possible.
null

While local leaders have a critical role to play on climate solutions, they need a bigger role on the global stage at COP climate talks. That’s changing at @COP28_UAE. 
 
In partnership with the COP28 Presidency, we’re convening the COP28 Local Climate Action Summit. Antha Williams explains more in the first of our Countdown to COP28 series, where team members from @Bloomberg and @BloombergDotOrg answer questions about the upcoming UN Conference on Climate Change.

What is COP? And why is @cop28uaeofficial so important? 

@bloombergdotorg’s Ailun Yang explains the basics of the annual UN Conference on Climate Change, outlines the most important conversations happening this year, and shares how the first-ever Global Stocktake will measure progress toward the Paris Agreement goals.

We can’t beat climate change while we’re still burning coal. 

Across @bloombergdotorg and @bloomberg, we’re helping accelerate the transition to clean energy. Here’s how.

#CityLab2023 was one for the books 🙌

Thanks to everyone who joined us in Washington, D.C. for conversations with mayors, cultural innovators, and business leaders on tackling urban challenges, sharing scalable solutions, and the importance of local leadership in delivering tangible results for residents of cities around the world.

Here’s a look at some of our favorite moments.

The climate crisis is no longer some far-off menace. It’s here and now.

From accelerating @bloombergdotorg’s efforts to protect 30% of the ocean by 2030, to powering @bloombergnef research, learn how we’re protecting biodiversity in key ecosystems ahead of @cop28uaeofficial.

What will the most important topics be at @cop28uaeofficial? In our latest Countdown to COP28 video, John Fraher from the @bloomberggreen news team shares four major themes he expects to drive conversations and media coverage at the global climate convening:

🌎 The global stocktake will track countries’ progress toward net zero goals
🌎 Climate finance and investments in green tech
🌎 Oil and gas companies’ role in fighting climate change
🌎 Renewable energy investments

Here’s an inside look at the new @johnshopkinsu Bloomberg Center at 555 Pennsylvania Avenue in Washington, D.C.
 
Built to bring together global leaders — especially the next generation of them — to enhance the free exchange of ideas, this Center will be it is a space for future leaders and innovators to explore, collaborate, and engage in dialogue to and advance solutions to the world’s most pressing challenges.

Companies need to combat climate change, too.

Across @bloomberg and @bloombergnef, we’re making climate data more transparent and helping to accelerate the pace of net-zero investments around the world. Here’s how.
The stakes to protect our planet from climate change could not be higher. We must tackle this challenge head on - not because it will be easy, but because it will be hard.

@everytown is working every day to defeat the gun lobby’s dangerous agenda and push for life-saving laws at every level of government. We have our work cut out for us. So starting today on Giving Tuesday, and through midnight this Sunday December 3rd, I’ll match your donation through the link in my bio. #givingtuesday

17,294 volunteers in 98 cities around the globe 🌏

This #GivingTuesday, we thank the @bloomberg employees who have committed their time and talents to making the world a better place this year - now that’s something to celebrate! #ImpactInAction

Holding @cop28uaeofficial in Dubai shines a spotlight on the Middle East’s important role in the clean energy transition and our net-zero future.

From bringing together local leaders and many others at COP28 to supporting data transparency for ongoing climate action, @bloombergdotorg and @bloomberg are helping accelerate that shift in the region, and around the world.
It was great to help open my friend @motzburger’s new joint @hamburger_america. My advice: Go for the burger, stay for the egg cream.

Nobody in our country exercised more influence over global affairs over a longer period of time than Henry Kissinger, and his death is a loss for our country and the world – and for all of us who were fortunate enough to call him a dear friend and mentor. Henry was incredibly kind and unfailingly devoted to his friends – a side of him that the public rarely saw – and endlessly generous with the wisdom gained over the course of an extraordinary life that included escaping Nazi Germany for New York, serving in World War II, and rising to become one of the most consequential public figures in American history, more so than many presidents. His legacy will shape the world for decades and even centuries to come. I’ll miss him dearly, and my heart goes out to Nancy and her family.
The key to @bloomberg’s success is our team - and we have a great team in Dubai. I was glad to connect with colleagues working in the UAE before heading to @cop28uaeofficial.

We have the technology to power the world with clean and renewable energy. The challenge we face in accelerating the transition is financing — especially in emerging markets and developing economies, or EMDEs.

The Global Capacity Building Coalition announced today at @cop28uaeofficial and supported by @BloombergDotOrg is designed to help solve that problem. It will bring together some of the world’s leading financial institutions to expand access to climate finance technical assistance programs for financial institutions in EMDEs. By driving more investment into those areas, we can unlock a clean energy transition that supports growth, prevents the use of heavily polluting fossil fuels, and moves us all toward a net-zero future.

No one feels the urgency for action on climate like the local leaders who are managing their cities and states through dangerous heat, wildfire threats, droughts, extreme weather, and other climate emergencies. 

Thank you to all of the mayors, governors, and other local leaders who took part in the #LocalClimateActionSummit hosted by @bloombergdotorg and @cop28uaeofficial.

Your understanding of what it takes to make real progress, and your willingness to collaborate across all levels of government, will help raise our global ambitions for the clean energy transition and a net-zero future.

Cities are leading the way when it comes to reducing emissions. To meet our climate goals, we need to give local leaders a seat at the table - to share ideas, make connections, and forge new partnerships.

That’s what the #LocalClimateActionSummit at @cop28uaeofficial is all about.

The Global Capacity Building Coalition, announced today at @cop28uaeofficial, is the broadest coalition ever created to help countries fight climate change in ways that promote economic growth, environmental resilience, and public health. 

UN agencies, multilateral development banks, private sector finance, and philanthropy leaders will collaborate to get climate finance where it needs to be in emerging markets and developing economies. #COP28 #COP28UAE

President @emmanuelmacron is a driving force for climate progress. His commitment to making climate data more transparent and accessible, powering past coal, and driving a green economy have made France a global leader in the climate fight - and I was glad to see him at @cop28uaeofficial. #COP28 #COP28UAE

@cop28uaeofficial’s CHAMP initiative, announced by Dr. Sultan al Jaber at the #LocalClimateActionSummit, will help cities and regional governments build stronger partnerships with national governments to raise global ambition and meet our climate goals faster. #COP28 #COP28UAE

Reducing emissions from heavy emitting sectors like industry and transportation is one of the biggest climate challenges we face.

Alongside @cop28uaeofficial President Dr. Sultan al Jaber and Mark Carney, today I announced the new Industrial Transition Accelerator, which will help companies cut carbon emissions and develop public policies that incentivize those cuts. Learn more at the link in my bio. #COP28 #COP28UAE

@unitednations Secretary-General @AntonioGuterres knows that every step mayors, governors and regional leaders take to fight climate change gets us closer to our Paris Agreement goals - and we’re glad he could join us for the @cop28uaeofficial #LocalClimateActionSummit. #COP28 #COP28UAE

7 million people around the world each year die too soon from breathing polluted air. At today’s #LocalClimateActionSummit at @cop28uaeofficial, we announced a new cohort of cities to join our @breathecities initiative alongside London and Warsaw – aiming to reduce air pollution by 30% by 2030 and prevent 39,000 premature deaths:

🔵 Accra, Ghana
🔵 Brussels, Belgium
🔵 Jakarta, Indonesia
🔵 Johannesburg, South Africa
🔵 Milan, Italy
🔵 Nairobi, Kenya
🔵 Paris, France
🔵 Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
🔵 Sofia, Bulgaria

Learn more at the link in bio.

Women are essential to economic growth. At @cop28uaeofficial, I sat down with Tanzanian President @samia_suluhu_hassan at the Q Coffee Café at Expo City, where we shared a cup of Q Coffee and Kazi Yetu tea. @questioncaferw is a social enterprise supported by @bloombergdotorg’s Women’s Economic Development Initiative, which trains women farmers and producers - and increases economic independence for them and their families.

If you’re at #COP28, don’t miss a stop at Q Coffee Café at Expo City. #COP28UAE

At COP21 in 2015 — as national leaders from 196 countries signed on to the Paris Agreement — Mayor @annehidalgo and I brought mayors together on the sidelines of the climate talks to elevate the role of local climate action in the work to protect our planet.

We’ve come a long way since then. At @cop28uaeofficial, mayors are center stage, offering up real solutions for cutting emissions and growing economies, showing how we can expand collaborations across all levels of government, and raising our ambitions for action that will meet the goals set in Paris eight years ago. #COP28 #COP28UAE

By 2050, carbon emissions from industry, transport, and energy sectors could increase by more than 30%.

To combat these emissions, I announced the Industrial Transition Accelerator alongside @cop28uaeofficial President Dr. Sultan al Jaber, @unclimatechange, and Mark Carney – the largest decarbonization initiative to date.

Learn more at the link in bio. #COP28 #COP28UAE

A historic first for local leaders at COP, and a big step toward a better future for our planet. 

The first-ever #LocalClimateActionSummit at @cop28uaeofficial highlighted innovative ideas and bold solutions taking shape in cities, states and regions at the center of global efforts to accelerate climate progress. #COP28 #COP28UAE

In 2023, we made a lot of progress on the biggest challenges we face: supporting student success, protecting our planet, helping people lead longer, healthier lives, and much more. I know next year is going to be even better. 

Wishing you a happy and restful holiday from everyone at @bloomberg and @bloombergdotorg.

@cop28uaeofficial brought historical firsts that, together, can do a lot to propel us forward. Now, we need to translate agreements into action. Read my @bloombergopinion piece about #COP28 at the link in my bio.

We all have a role to play in protecting our planet. At @cop28uaeofficial, @bloomberg and @bloombergdotorg collaborated to accelerate climate finance, preserve ocean ecosystems, tackle air pollution, and give local leaders a seat at the table.

Gun violence is the number one cause of death for children and teens across the United States. We deserve better. 
 
@everytown is committed to bringing an end to the gun violence devastating our country - but the movement needs your help. If you make a donation to further their work at the link in my bio before the end of the year, I’ll triple match your gift.
Entrepreneur, philanthropist, UN Secretary-General’s Special Envoy for Climate Ambition & Solutions, mayor of NYC, father, grandfather, and data nerd.
